name: Advanced Studies in Voice Problems
title: SoC CSD 493-2-20 Advanced Studies in Voice Problems

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will help you develop problem-solving skills necessary for treatment of patients with voice disorders.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: CSD 301 and CSD 493-1 or by permission

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
By the end of the course, students will be able to:

Justify behavioral treatments for appropriate voice disorders and identify contraindicated treatments.
Apply a decision-making model and principles of ethics to assist in the resolution of case scenarios in special populations.
Evaluate, critique, and/or generate new knowledge relevant to the prevention and treatment of communication disorders in special populations.
Demonstrate safe and informed laboratory practice with selected technology.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Format: You will be responsible for directing your own learning and assisting your peers with their learning through guided instruction from the course instructor. You will select content areas of interest to you.
